Race.SummaryText:
City of Shreveport Proposition
(Sales Tax Renewal)

Summary:  Five years, one-fourth of one percent renewal sales tax to be levied within the City of Shreveport, to be expended by the City of Shreveport for salaries, benefits, equipment and personnel for the Police and Fire Departments.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Shreveport, State of Louisiana (the "City"), under the provisions of La. R.S. 47:338.16 and other constitutional and statutory authority supplemental thereto, be authorized to levy and collect, and adopt an ordinance providing for such levy and collection, a renewal tax of one-fourth of one percent (1/4%) (the "Tax"), upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption, and the storage for use or consumption of tangible personal property and on sales of services, all as presently or thereafter defined in Chapter 2 of Subtitle II of Title 47 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950 (an estimated $10,600,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), within the corporate limits of the City of Shreveport for a period of five years beginning January 1, 2013 and ending December 31, 2017, with the avails or proceeds of the Tax (after paying the reasonable and necessary costs and expenses of collecting and administering the Tax) to be dedicated and used solely and exclusively for salaries, benefits, equipment and personnel for the Police and Fire Departments of the City of Shreveport?

Race.SpecificTitle: Bayou Lafourche Fresh Water District -- 2.11 Mills - BOC - 20 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Bayou Lafourche Fresh Water District Proposition
(Tax Renewal)

Summary:  20 year, 2.11 mills property tax renewal for the purpose of acquiring, administering, constructing, improving, maintaining and/or operating improvements, equipment, structures, facilities, projects and programs of and for the Bayou Lafourche Fresh Water District, including paying personnel costs.
Race.FullText: Shall Bayou Lafourche Fresh Water District (the "District"), be authorized to levy a special tax of two and eleven hundredths (2.11) mills on all property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $2,129,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of twenty (20) years, beginning with the year 2014 and ending with the year 2033, for the purpose of acquiring, administering, constructing, improving, maintaining and/or operating improvements, equipment, structures, facilities, projects and programs of and for the District, including paying personnel costs?
